bSelectEdgeLoops: When true, will select edge loops. Edge loops are either paths through vertices with 4 edges, or boundaries of holes.
bSelectEdgeRings: When set, will select rings of edges that are opposite each other across a quad face.
bHitBackFaces: When set, faces that face away from the camera are ignored in selection and occlusion. Useful for working with inside-out meshes.
bMarqueeIgnoreOcclusion: Determines whether vertices should be checked for occlusion in marquee select (Note: marquee select currently only works with edges and vertices)
bPreferProjectedElement: Prefer to select an edge projected to a point rather than the point, or a face projected to an edge rather than the edge.
bSelectDownRay: If the closest element is valid, select other elements behind it that are aligned with it.
bIgnoreOcclusion: Do not check whether the closest element is occluded from the current view.
